title: Space Force releases final call for bids for national security launch services
summary: The U.S. Space Force on Oct. 4 released two solicitations for the next round of national security launch contracts, known as National Security Space Launch Phase 3.

title: Russia blames Luna-25 crash on computer glitch
summary: Russia says its first lunar lander mission in nearly half a century crashed in August because of faulty commands in an onboard computer during a maneuver.

title: NASA expands purchase of commercial Earth-observation data with latest award
summary: Airbus DS Geo, Capella Space, GHGSat, Maxar, PlanetiQ, Spire Global and Umbra were selected under the fixed-price, indefinite delivery, indefinite quantity contract to provide Earth observation data and services in support of NASA research.

title: LMI gets $98 million contract for space wargaming software
summary: The U.S. Air Force awarded the Logistics Management Institute, known as LMI, a $98 million contract for modeling and simulation software to analyze warfighting missions in space.

title: China wants a lunar satellite constellation to support deep space missions
summary: China’s space authorities want to build an expansive, three-stage communication, navigation and remote sensing network to facilitate deep space operations.
